definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: They've never been able to come to grips with the fact they're bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 他們永遠也無法面對自己是破產者的事實。
中產階級的破產者將越來越多。

sentences.english: The bankrupt and the men to whom he owed money arranged an accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 破產者和他的債權人協議調解。

sentences.english: The bankrupts and the creditors are usually in competing position for respective interests.
sentences.chinese: 破產者和債權人在各自的利益上通常處於競爭的狀態。

sentences.english: The bankrupt must assign all of his patents to the receiver.
sentences.chinese: 破產者必須把所有的專利權轉讓給破產管理人。

sentences.english: China doesn't WANT the US to become bankrupt, and of course we won't.
sentences.chinese: 中國並不想要我們成爲破產者，當然我們不會。

sentences.english: The bankrupt had made over all his property to his wife.
sentences.chinese: 這個破產者已把他所有的財產轉讓給了他的妻子。

sentences.english: Who cares if he is a damn bankrupt ?
sentences.chinese: 誰在乎他是個倒黴的破產者啊？

sentences.english: Receivers . You can practically smell them.
sentences.chinese: 破產者，你幾乎可以嗅出來了。
